name: Shivaleela Uppula
title: Senior AI Solutions Consultant - Enterprise Legal & Procurement AI
professional_summary: I am having 10 years of experience in solution consulting, AI implementation, and enterprise application delivery across Healthcare, Insurance, Government, and Finance domains, specializing in AI agent solutions for legal workflows and ERP integrations.

Engineered multi-agent AI systems using CrewAI and LangGraph to automate contract review workflows for healthcare procurement, integrating with existing ERP modules to streamline vendor onboarding while ensuring strict HIPAA compliance and data governance standards.

Designed and implemented AI-enabled business process redesign for legal operations, translating stakeholder requirements into scalable technical solutions that reduced manual review cycles by automating clause extraction and obligation identification.

Led enterprise AI implementation projects from proof-of-concept to production, configuring AI agents for compliance monitoring and document analysis to meet rigorous healthcare, insurance, and financial regulatory requirements.

Architected end-to-end process integration solutions connecting AI agents with procurement and payments modules within SAP ERP environments, establishing reliable data flows for automated financial and legal decision support.

Developed comprehensive solution documentation and architecture diagrams for AI agent deployments, creating runbooks and implementation best practices that enabled operational teams to manage complex multi-agent workflows effectively.

Conducted stakeholder management sessions with legal, finance, and procurement teams to gather requirements for AI solutions, employing a consultative approach to build trusted advisor relationships across diverse organizational functions.

Configured AI agents for legal workflow automation, focusing on risk identification and contract review processes while aligning with enterprise security standards and data governance policies specific to regulated industries.

Delivered solution demonstrations and pre-sales support for AI agent implementations, showcasing how AI-enabled business process redesign could transform case management and compliance monitoring operations.

Spearheaded the translation of business requirements into scalable technical solutions for AI agent deployments, ensuring these solutions integrated seamlessly with existing enterprise systems via robust API frameworks.

Directed the design of RAG pipelines for legal document analysis, implementing document retrieval patterns that enabled efficient search and clause extraction from extensive healthcare contract repositories.

Orchestrated the integration of AI solutions with enterprise systems using REST APIs and event-based patterns, ensuring reliable data exchange between AI agents and core ERP, procurement, and payments modules.

Championed governance and compliance considerations for AI solutions in regulated domains, embedding performance and reliability requirements into the solution design from initial proof-of-concept stages.

Formulated AI workflow automation strategies that transformed legal operations processes, reducing manual effort in document analysis while maintaining audit trails for regulatory compliance and oversight.
Pioneered the application of LLM-based agents for specialized legal workflows, adapting general AI capabilities to address domain-specific challenges in contract review and compliance monitoring.

Assembled cross-functional collaboration frameworks between technology teams and business stakeholders, facilitating effective communication that ensured AI solutions met both technical and operational needs.
Evaluated enterprise security standards for AI agent deployments, implementing data governance alignment measures that protected sensitive legal and financial information within integrated systems.

Synthesized complex business requirements from legal, procurement, and finance stakeholders into coherent AI solution designs, balancing functional needs with technical constraints and regulatory mandates.

experience.role: Senior Data Engineer-AI/ML with Gen AI
responsibilities: Deployed CrewAI multi-agent systems to automate healthcare contract review workflows, addressing manual inefficiencies in vendor agreement processing by implementing AI agents for clause extraction and risk identification, which accelerated contract turnaround by 72 hours while maintaining HIPAA compliance.

Architected AI agent solutions integrating with Medline's SAP procurement modules, solving disjointed data flows between legal review and purchasing systems by developing event-driven APIs that synchronized contract approvals with procurement workflows, ensuring seamless end-to-end process integration.

Led the design of an AI-enabled business process redesign for legal operations, tackling excessive manual document analysis by configuring specialized agents for compliance monitoring and obligation tracking, which reduced legal team workload by approximately 40% on routine contract reviews.

Configured LangGraph workflows for complex legal decision support, overcoming sequential processing limitations by implementing parallel agent orchestration that enabled simultaneous review of contractual, regulatory, and financial aspects, improving review comprehensiveness.

Executed a comprehensive proof-of-concept for AI-driven contract workflow automation, demonstrating feasibility to stakeholders by building a functional prototype that extracted key clauses and identified risks in vendor agreements, securing executive approval for full implementation.

Engineered RAG pipelines for healthcare legal document analysis, solving information retrieval challenges from vast contract repositories by implementing semantic search with specialized embeddings, enabling precise extraction of HIPAA-related clauses and compliance requirements.

Developed solution documentation and architecture diagrams for the AI agent deployment, addressing knowledge transfer gaps by creating detailed runbooks that outlined configuration procedures, troubleshooting steps, and integration patterns with existing ERP systems.

Orchestrated stakeholder management sessions with legal, procurement, and finance teams, bridging communication gaps by translating business requirements into technical specifications for AI agents, ensuring the solution addressed cross-functional needs effectively.

Implemented governance frameworks for AI solutions in healthcare, confronting regulatory compliance challenges by establishing data governance protocols and security standards that ensured protected health information remained secure throughout automated processing.

Designed REST API integrations connecting AI agents with payment modules, resolving data synchronization issues by building reliable interfaces that transmitted approved contract terms to financial systems, automating payment term configuration and reducing manual entry errors.

Pioneered the use of Model Context Protocol for agent communication, tackling inter-agent coordination problems by establishing standardized data exchange formats that improved system reliability and made debugging agent interactions more straightforward.

Conducted solution demonstrations for pre-sales support with prospective healthcare clients, showcasing AI agent capabilities by walking through realistic contract review scenarios that highlighted automation benefits while addressing specific regulatory concerns.

Formulated implementation best practices for multi-agent deployments, overcoming operational inconsistencies by documenting configuration standards, monitoring approaches, and performance validation techniques that ensured system reliability during high-volume processing periods.

Troubleshot performance issues in production AI workflows, diagnosing latency in contract processing by analyzing agent interaction patterns and optimizing LangGraph execution plans, which restored system responsiveness to service level agreements.

Championed cross-functional collaboration between technology and legal teams, facilitating weekly alignment meetings that addressed integration challenges and prioritized feature development based on evolving regulatory requirements and business needs.

Evaluated different LLM models for legal workflow applications, conducting comparative testing to identify optimal balance between accuracy, cost, and processing speed for healthcare contract analysis, ultimately selecting a hybrid approach for production deployment.

Built AI agent solutions for insurance contract review automation, confronting manual processing delays by implementing CrewAI-based systems that extracted policy clauses and identified coverage limitations, streamlining provider agreement reviews.

Integrated AI workflow automation with existing claims management systems, solving data silo problems by developing API connectors that enabled AI agents to access historical claims data for pattern analysis, improving contract adequacy assessments.

Assembled proof-of-concept demonstrations for legal AI solutions, showcasing automation potential to insurance stakeholders by creating working prototypes that processed sample provider contracts and highlighted risk areas requiring manual review.

Verified reliability of AI solutions through rigorous testing, designing test cases that simulated edge conditions in insurance contracts to ensure agent behavior remained predictable and accurate across diverse policy types and structures.
